channel.title: Our Table on Our Table - Recipe Collection
channel.description: Recent content in Our Table on Our Table - Recipe Collection

item.title: 1 medium jicama root, peeled and sliced into thick matchsticks
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 1/2 cup mayonnaise
  2. 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar
  3. 2 tangerines
  4. 2 (14.8-ounce) jars or cans hearts of palm
  5. 2 California avocados
  6. 4 cups packed trimmed arugula
  7. In a bowl, whisk together mayonnaise and vinegar until smooth. Cut peel and pith from tangerine and, holding fruit over a small bowl (to catch juice) cut sections free from membranes, discarding seeds.
  8. Rinse and drain hearts of palm and diagonally cut into 3/4-inch-thick slices. Pit and peel avocado and cut into 10-inch pieces. Tear arugula into bite-size pieces and add to dressing with tangerine and juice, hearts of palm, and avocado.
  9. Toss salad to coat with dressing and season with salt and pepper.
  10. Avocado, Orange, and Jicama Salad

item.title: 1 pound medium to thick asparagus, trimmed
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. With a sharp knife, cut asparagus diagonally into very thin slices and transfer to a large bowl. Halve large mushrooms. Slice mushrooms very thin and add with radishes to asparagus. Toss salad gently.
  2. In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, mustard and salt. Add oil in a stream, whisking, and whisk until emulsified. Drizzle dressing over asparagus salad and toss gently. Grind pepper over salad.
  3. Spread watercress on a platter and top with asparagus salad. With a vegetable peeler, shave 1/2 to 3/4 of Parmesan into curls over salad, reserving remaining Parmesan for another use.

item.title: 1/2 cup mayonnaise
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 3 navel oranges
  2. 1/2 teaspoon curry powder
  3. 1/2 teaspoon salt
  4. 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin
  5. 1/4 teaspoon sugar
  6. 2 tablespoons white-wine vinegar
  7. 2 tablespoons olive oil
  8. 1 medium jicama (about 3/4 pound)
  9. 2 firm-ripe California avocados
  10. With a sharp knife cut peel and pith from oranges. Working over a bowl, cut sections free from membranes and squeeze enough juice from membranes to measure 1/4 cup. In a bowl whisk together orange juice, curry powder, salt, cumin, sugar, and vinegar. Add oil in a stream, whisking until emulsified. Peel jicama and halve lengthwise. Thinly slice jicama crosswise and add to vinaigrette, tossing to combine. Halve, pit, and peel avocados and thinly slice crosswise.
  11. Lift jicama from vinaigrette and arrange on 4 plates with orange sections and avocado. Pour remaining vinaigrette over and around salads.

item.title: 1/3 cup olive oil, eye ball it
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Spinach, Strawberry, and Hearts of Palm Salad
  2. 1/3 cup cider vinegar
  3. 3/4 cup sugar
  4. 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
  5. 1 teaspoon salt
  6. 1 cup vegetable oil
  7. 1/2 small red onion, grated
  8. 1 1/2 tablespoons poppy seeds
  9. 1 teaspoon dry mustard
  10. 1/2 teaspoon paprika
  11. 1 1/2 pounds fresh spinach, washed and torn into pieces
  12. 1 can hearts of palm, drained and chopped
  13. 2 cups strawberries, stemmed and sliced
  14. 1 cup chopped walnuts

item.title: 2 hearts romaine lettuce, chopped
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 1/3 cup olive oil, eye ball it
  2. Salt and pepper
  3. Arrange chopped lettuce on a platter. Trim a thin slice of orange skin down to the flesh off the top and bottom of the orange. Stand the orange upright and trim off strips of the remaining peel working from top to bottom around the orange. Cut each orange then in 1/2 lengthwise. Slice the 1/2 oranges into 1/2 moon shapes. Arrange the sliced oranges around the chopped romaine. Lightly toast the almonds in a small skillet over moderate heat or in a toaster or conventional oven. Top the romaine and oranges with toasted almonds and chopped tarragon.
  4. In a small bowl, combine honey, vinegar, orange juice and mustard with a whisk. Stream in the oil while continuing to whisk the dressing to combine it. Pour the dressing evenly over the entire salad platter in a slow, thin stream. Season the salad with salt and pepper. The salad is pretty as is, no tossing.

item.title: 2 tablespoons pomegranate juice
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Spinach Salad with Dried Cranberries, Walnuts and Pomegranate Vinaigrette

item.title: 3/4 pound, 4 to 5 cups, baby spinach, packed
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Combine spinach and artichokes. Place garlic, lemon zest and juice in small dish and add vinegar. Let it stand 5 minutes then whisk in extra-virgin olive oil. Pour oil and vinegar dressing over salad and toss to combine. Season the salad with salt and pepper, to your taste. Top the salad with cheese then serve.

item.title: 4 oranges, preferably seedless
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Segment and juice 3 of the oranges in the following way: Cut both ends off 1 of the oranges and place it, cut side up, on a cutting board. Using a sharp, flexible knife, cut the skin and white membrane from the orange. Use a sawing motion and cut from top to bottom following the contours of the orange. Free the orange segments but cutting along the seams that separate them from each other. Do this over a bowl to collect any juices. Reserve the segments separately and squeeze what's left of the orange over the bowl to collect the juice. Do the same with the remaining 2 oranges. Strain the juice into a measuring cup: You should have about 3/4 cup; if not, juice the remaining orange and add as much as needed.
  2. Combine the ginger, mayonnaise, mustard, and honey with 1/2 cup of the orange juice in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
  3. In a small bowl, combine half of the chopped shallots with 3 tablespoons of the remaining orange juice. Whisk in the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
  4. Cut the avocados lengthwise up to the large pit in the middle. Gently twist apart the 2 halves and remove the pit. Wedge a teaspoon between the skin and the flesh and remove the flesh in 1 piece. Cut the avocados into 1-inch pieces and put them into the bowl with the honey-and-ginger dressing. Add the remaining shallots, the chopped mint and the chopped cilantro, and mix together lightly so as not to break up the avocado.
  5. When ready to serve, set aside 8 orange segments. Toss the rest with the whole lettuce leaves and just enough of the orange-and-olive oil vinaigrette to coat. Divide the lettuce and oranges among 4 plates. Spoon some avocado onto each plate (there will be some dressing left in the bowl). Top with the reserved orange segments and drizzle any remaining honey-and-ginger dressing over the salad. Garnish with whole mint and cilantro leaves, and, if you like, some pickled ginger.

item.title: 4 portobello mushroom caps, wiped clean and very thinly sliced
item.description:

item.title: Asparagus and Mushroom Salad with Shaved Parmesan
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 1 pound medium to thick asparagus, trimmed
  2. 1/2 pound mushrooms, stems trimmed even with caps
  3. 4 medium radishes, halved lengthwise and sliced thin crosswise
  4. 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
  5. 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
  6. 1/2 teaspoon salt
  7. 1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil
  8. Freshly ground black pepper
  9. 1 bunch watercress, coarse stems discarded
  10. 1/4-pound piece Parmesan, room temperature

item.title: Avocado and Orange Salad with Honey and Ginger Dressing
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 4 oranges, preferably seedless
  2. 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh ginger
  3. 3 tablespoons mayonnaise
  4. 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  5. 2 teaspoons honey
  6. Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
  7. 2 medium shallots, finely chopped
  8. 1 to 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
  9. 2 avocados
  10. 1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint leaves, plus whole leaves for garnish
  11. 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves, plus whole leaves for garnish
  12. 4 whole leaves Boston lettuce, washed and dried well
  13. 4 while leaves red leaf lettuce, washed and dried well
  14. Sliced pickled ginger, optional

item.title: Blueberry and Toasted Pecan Salad
item.description:
Yield: 4 servings | Prep: 15m | Cook: 15m | Total: 30m

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Coat pecans with butter and toast at 350°F for 15 minutes.
  2. Cool, then toss with blueberries and spinach.
  3. Whisk olive oil and vinegar.
  4. Drizzle vinaigrette and serve.

item.title: Cactus Salad
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 3 navel oranges
  2. 1 1/2 pounds fresh or prepared cactus paddles or nopales, needles removed
  3. 3/4 cup olive oil
  4. 1 1/2 teaspoons salt
  5. 4 Italian Roma tomatoes, cored, seeded and cut into 1/4-inch dice
  6. 1/2 small red onion, cut into 1/4-inch dice
  7. 1 to 2 medium serrano chiles, stemmed, seeded and finely diced
  8. 2 bunches cilantro, leaves only, chopped
  9. 1/2 cup finely grated Cotija or Anejo cheese
  10. 1/2 cup red wine vinegar
  11. 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
  12. 4 to 6 lettuce leaves
  13. 1 avocado, peeled, seeded and sliced for garnish
  14. 1/4 cup cracked black pepper garnish, recipe follows

item.title: Cactus Salad
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 1 1/2 pounds fresh or prepared cactus paddles or nopales, needles removed
  2. 3/4 cup olive oil
  3. 1 1/2 teaspoons salt
  4. 4 Italian Roma tomatoes, cored, seeded and cut into 1/4-inch dice
  5. 1/2 small red onion, cut into 1/4-inch dice
  6. 1 to 2 medium serrano chiles, stemmed, seeded and finely diced
  7. 2 bunches cilantro, leaves only, chopped
  8. 1/2 cup finely grated Cotija or Anejo cheese
  9. 1/2 cup red wine vinegar
  10. 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
  11. 4 to 6 lettuce leaves
  12. 1 avocado, peeled, seeded and sliced for garnish
  13. 1/4 cup cracked black pepper garnish, recipe follows

item.title: Combine spinach and artichokes. Place garlic, lemon zest and juice in small dish and add vinegar. Let it stand 5 minutes then whisk in extra-virgin olive oil. Pour oil and vinegar dressing over salad and toss to combine. Season the salad with salt and pepper, to your taste. Top the salad with cheese then serve.
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Avocado and Orange Salad with Honey and Ginger Dressing

item.title: For the dressing, combine the vinegar, sugar, lemon juice, and salt in a small non-reactive saucepan and heat over medium heat until the sugar dissolves, stirring frequently. Remove pan from heat and let cool to room temperature. When cooled, whisk in the oil, onion, poppy seeds, dry mustard and paprika until thoroughly combined. Set dressing aside. In a salad bowl, combine the spinach, hearts of palm, strawberries, and walnuts. When ready to serve, add some of the dressing, and toss gently. Serve the remaining dressing alongside the salad so diners may add more, if desired.
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Heck of a Jicama Salad

item.title: Greek Salad
item.description:
Yield: 6 servings | Prep: 20m | Cook: 0m | Total: 20m

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Arrange vegetables, feta, capers, and olives.
  2. Whisk oregano, vinegar, salt, pepper, oil.
  3. Drizzle over salad.

item.title: Heck of a Jicama Salad
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 1 medium jicama root, peeled and sliced into thick matchsticks
  2. 1 teaspoon salt
  3. 2 teaspoons sugar
  4. 2 limes, juiced
  5. 2 hearts romaine, chopped
  6. 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves, a handful of leaves, finely chopped
  7. 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin, eyeball it in the palm of your hand
  8. 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, eyeball it
  9. Freshly ground black pepper
  10. Place jicama in a bowl, sprinkle with salt and sugar, and add the juice of 1 lime. Let jicama stand 15 minutes. While jicama softens, work on the rest of your meal.
  11. Arrange romaine on a serving plate. Top romaine with jicama. Juice 1 lime into a small bowl, add cilantro and cumin. Whisk in extra-virgin olive oil in a slow stream. Pour dressing over salad and season with salt and pepper.
  12. Hearts of Palm Salad

item.title: Holiday Salad
item.description:
Yield: 6 servings | Prep: 20m | Cook: 10m | Total: 30m

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Whisk juice, zest, vinegar, shallots, salt, pepper, mustard.
  2. Add oil, whisk to emulsify.
  3. Fold oranges and onions into 1/4 cup dressing.
  4. Wrap goat cheese with prosciutto, sear in skillet.
  5. Combine greens, add oranges and onions, toss with dressing.
  6. Plate salads, top with goat cheese, garnish with pomegranate seeds.

item.title: Mandarin Orange Tossed Salad
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Serves: 6
  2. Salad:
  3. 1/2 cup slivered almonds
  4. 3 T. sugar
  5. 1/2 head iceberg lettuce
  6. 1/2 head romaine or leafy lettuce (or try spinach)
  7. 1/2 sweet, red onion, sliced into rings
  8. 1 (11-oz) can mandarin oranges, drained
  9. Dressing:
  10. 3 T. orange juice
  11. 3 T. vegetable oil (try olive)
  12. 2 T. vinegar
  13. 1 T. sugar or honey
  14. 1-2 t. poppy seeds, optional
  15. 1/4 t. salt
  16. In frying pan, heat 3 T. sugar over med-low heat until melted (sugar turns liquid). Sprinkle almonds into sugar and stir to coat (almonds clump together). Pour onto a greased plate and let cool; separate. Tear clean, dry greens into bite-sized pieces. Toss greens with sliced onion rings (reserve some for garnish), drained oranges, and cooled, separated candied almonds.
  17. Shake dressing ingredients together until combined. When ready to serve, pour dressing over salad and toss gently to coat. Garnish with onion rings. Serve immediately. Serves 6

item.title: Orange and Almond Salad
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 2 hearts romaine lettuce, chopped
  2. 3 navel oranges
  3. 2 ounces, 1/4 cup, sliced almonds or slivered almonds, available on the baking aisle, toasted
  4. 2 tablespoons chopped fresh tarragon, 2 or 3 sprigs
  5. Splash orange juice
  6. 2 rounded teaspoons honey
  7. 2 tablespoons tarragon vinegar
  8. 1/4 teaspoon dry mustard, a couple of pinches

item.title: Parmesan Crisps
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 1/2 cup grated Parmesan
  2. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
  3. Pour a heaping tablespoon of Parmesan onto a silicone or parchment lined baking sheet and lightly pat down. A silicone baking sheet is highly recommended. Repeat with the remaining cheese, spacing the spoonfuls about a 1/2 inch apart.
  4. Bake for 3 to 5 minutes or until golden and crisp. Cool.

item.title: Portobello Mushroom Salad
item.description:
Yield: 4 servings | Prep: 15m | Cook: 0m | Total: 15m

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Arrange mushrooms, celery, parsley.
  2. Squeeze lemon, drizzle oil, season.
  3. Toss lightly.
  4. Shave Parmesan over top.

item.title: Preheat grill or broiler. Place cactus paddles in a bowl and toss with 1/4 cup of the olive oil and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Grill or broil the paddles until grill marks appear on each side, or they turn dark green with black patches, about 3 to 5 minutes. Set aside to cool to room temperature. Cover and chill 2 to 4 hours or overnight. Cut cactus into 1/2-inch pieces. In a large bowl, combine the cactus, tomatoes, onions, chiles, cilantro and cheese with the remaining 1/2 cup oil, the vinegar, the remaining 1 teaspoon salt and pepper. Toss well. Serve on plates lined with lettuce leaves, and garnish with avocado slices sprinkled with cracked pepper garnish.
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. CRACKED BLACK PEPPER GARNISH
  2. 2 tablespoons cracked black pepper
  3. 1/2 cup olive oil
  4. 2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice
  5. 1 teaspoon salt
  6. In a small bowl, stir all the ingredients together. Spoon over vegetables or drizzle lightly over dressed salads as a garnish.

item.title: Sausage Balls
item.description:
Yield: About 24 balls | Prep: 10m | Cook: 15m | Total: 25m

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
  2. In a large bowl, mix sausage, Bisquick, and cheddar until combined.
  3. Roll into small balls and place on an ungreased baking sheet.
  4. Bake 12–15 minutes, or 15–25 minutes if baking from frozen, until golden brown and cooked through.

Nutrition (per serving)

Calories: 140, Protein: 6 g, Carbs: 8 g, Fat: 9 g

item.title: Segment and juice 3 of the oranges in the following way: Cut both ends off 1 of the oranges and place it, cut side up, on a cutting board. Using a sharp, flexible knife, cut the skin and white membrane from the orange. Use a sawing motion and cut from top to bottom following the contours of the orange. Free the orange segments but cutting along the seams that separate them from each other. Do this over a bowl to collect any juices. Reserve the segments separately and squeeze what's left of the orange over the bowl to collect the juice. Do the same with the remaining 2 oranges. Strain the juice into a measuring cup: You should have about 3/4 cup; if not, juice the remaining orange and add as much as needed.

Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

  1. Orange and Almond Salad

item.title: Spinach and Artichoke salad
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. 3/4 pound, 4 to 5 cups, baby spinach, packed
  2. 2 (15-ounce) cans artichoke hearts packed in water, drained and sliced
  3. 1 clove garlic, finely chopped
  4. 2 teaspoons lemon zest
  5. 1 tablespoon lemon juice
  6. 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
  7. 1/4 to 1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil
  8. Salt and pepper
  9. A handful shredded Parmigiano-Reggiano

item.title: Spinach Salad with Dried Cranberries, Walnuts and Pomegranate Vinaigrette
item.description:
Yield: 4 servings | Prep: 10m | Cook: 0m | Total: 10m

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Shake juice, vinegar, oil, mustard.
  2. Season with salt and pepper.
  3. Arrange spinach, cranberries, walnuts.
  4. Pour vinaigrette.

item.title: Spinach, Strawberry, and Hearts of Palm Salad
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. For the dressing, combine the vinegar, sugar, lemon juice, and salt in a small non-reactive saucepan and heat over medium heat until the sugar dissolves, stirring frequently. Remove pan from heat and let cool to room temperature. When cooled, whisk in the oil, onion, poppy seeds, dry mustard and paprika until thoroughly combined. Set dressing aside. In a salad bowl, combine the spinach, hearts of palm, strawberries, and walnuts. When ready to serve, add some of the dressing, and toss gently. Serve the remaining dressing alongside the salad so diners may add more, if desired.

item.title: Walnut-Parmesan Pesto Sauce
item.description:
Yield: 1 1/4 cups | Prep: 10m | Cook: 0m | Total: 10m

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor.
  2. Pulse until smooth, scraping down the sides as needed.
  3. Stir into hot pasta or spoon over cream cheese and serve with crackers.

Nutrition (per serving)

Calories: 120, Protein: 3 g, Carbs: 2 g, Fat: 12 g

item.title: With a sharp knife, cut asparagus diagonally into very thin slices and transfer to a large bowl. Halve large mushrooms. Slice mushrooms very thin and add with radishes to asparagus. Toss salad gently.
item.description:
Yield: | Prep: | Cook: | Total:

Ingredients

Steps

  1. Spinach and Artichoke salad
